meanings.definition: Ready to believe, especially on slight or uncertain evidence.
meanings.sent1: The credulous child believed in the tooth fairy without any proof.
meanings.sent2: She was so credulous that she fell for every scam that came her way.
meanings.sent3: The credulous puppy thought the vacuum cleaner was a monster!
meanings.sent4: His credulous nature made him an easy target for con artists.
meanings.sent5: The credulous tourist thought the street performer's magic was real.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of skepticism or critical thinking.
meanings.sent1: The credulous student accepted everything the teacher said without question.
meanings.sent2: Her credulous nature led her to believe every rumor she heard.
meanings.sent3: The credulous cat thought the mirror reflection was another cat.
meanings.sent4: Being credulous in a world full of deceit can lead to trouble.
meanings.sent5: The credulous audience was easily swayed by the charismatic speaker.
